headline: Simple Roasted Butternut Squash
description: Easy roasted butternut squash is nice and tender and perfect alongside any meal. It's ready in just 40 minutes for a weeknight or a holiday gathering.

video.description: A super simple, savory side dish that’s ready in no time.
video.name: Simple Roasted Butternut Squash

name: Simple Roasted Butternut Squash
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Peel butternut squash with a sharp vegetable peeler. Cut in half lengthwise; scoop out and discard seeds. Cut halves into 1-inch slices, then cut slices into 1-inch cubes.
Combine butternut squash cubes, olive oil, and garlic in a large bowl and toss until well coated. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast in the preheated oven until squash is lightly browned and tender when pierced with a fork, 25 to 35 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made the recipe exactly as written and thought it was very good, although next time will try suggested spices of rosemary or thyme to change it up a bit. My hubby ate it but it wasn't his favorite.
Easy and tasty. I put the squash on parchment paper to roast. Makes for easy clean up!
Made it as a side to go with our chicken pot pies and there were no leftovers. Yummy!
Used peach syrup instead and covered the pan. Enjoyed the fact that it was simple and quick
I added honey which adds the sweet with the pepper and garlic.
Quick, easy and delicious!
It was absolutely delicious. The minced garlic and roasting the squash enhanced the flavor to perfection.
should be covered , otherwise squash dries out a bit
Perfect recipe for roasted butternut. Great just as it is.
Awesome tasting yummm
My new favorite vegetable. I think I'll even blend up some of it like a polenta/mashed potato alternative. I did not expect to like it much less love it. Amazing!
Quick and easy, but the taste was too squashy.
I used cinnamon and a sprinkling of brown sugar with the olive oil instead of the garlic, salt and pepper. Was looking for something sweet to go with the savory roasted baby potatoes I was making.

My daughter said this was the BEST butternut squash I've ever made. I used garlic powder instead of minced garlic. The peeling was a big pain, but I did follow others instructions to poke with fork and microwave for 3 minutes. Cutting the squash into 1" pieces was a big chore as mine was very hard. Overall I would make this again, but I do need to invest in a larger peeler and an good attitude. :-)
Tasty! Squash comes in all sizes, so a weight might help. I used the top of a large heavy squash and it was about right for the amount of ingredients.

I made this recipe and didn’t change any of the ingredients. It was delicious!! I loved it and my husband did too. I’ve never been one to enjoy cooking, but it was easy and quick to make. It’s a welcome recipe in my ever expanding list. Thank you!!
First time making butternut squash. Family loved it! Will be making again. I added paprika to give it a little kick.
Delicious!
good and simple
Easy and delicious!!
Very easy to make. Very tasty to eat. I did use garlic powder instead of minced garlic.
Great as is and also with a few red pepper flakes to spice it up a bit.
Very good! It took longer to roast than the instructions indicated, but that might be my oven.
My first time eating squash! It was excellent. I ate it right at the pan. I do recommend this easy recipe.
I loved it , I used coconut oil instead of olive oil and it still tastes good. I love that it roasted yet moist. I cooked it past the recommended time but it didn’t burn; it tastes good.
Tasted delicious. Easy to prepare.
Super simple, but I tweaked it with some cayenne.
So easy but so delicious.

This was very simple, cooked through fast. The only changes I did was I purchase already minced garlic so I used that, and I used olive oil that has Italian seasonings mixed in. (I always have by the stove, olive oil w/herbs added, that's been decanted from a large bottle of olive oil.)
Good. Keep the slices uniformally thin for a consistent texture.
Made it exactly as written and it came out perfectly. The reviewer who explained the best way to peel the squash was spot on too! I will definitely be making this again.
I made this recipe many times, it's a go-to for weeknight meals. I also blend leftovers with coconut milk and spices for a quick soup.

With over 1000 5-star reviews! Proves that a delicious recipe doesn’t have to be complex and difficult! I didn’t have the full amount of butternut squash needed so I had to half the recipe. Served this with a roasted ham and asparagus (pairs splendidly!) so while I had to increase my cooking time. Would absolutely make again and again. A new favorite!! Thank you!

Quick and easy, though I did end up tossing it under the broiler for a few minutes at thee end to get it to brown up a little. I think next time I would add maybe a touch of brown sugar and some rosemary- parmesan would be a nice touch too. But good as written as well!

I couldn’t leave well enough alone and added about a quarter cup of diced pancetta. I threw it all into a pan with cooked fresh linguine with a table spoon of butter with about a 1/2 cup of pasta water. I hate to watch my sage plant not get used so I fried some whole leaves in olive oil as a crunchy garnish. I might throw in toasted Pine nuts next time.

This dish was simply delicious! I made it according to the recipe exactly. HOORAH to the reviewer on how to easily peel. Piercing with a fork and placing it in the microwave for 3 minutes was genius! I always roast the seeds too WE LOVE THEM. Don’t toss them - try it you’ll like it.

Great simple recipe! Loved it. This will become a regular dish. 
Thanks!
This is an amazing way to make butternut squash! I will definitely be making this again.

Turned out great. I am a picky eater and this was my first time ever cooking and/or eating butternut squash. I made garlic roasted and butter/brown sugar roasted. Both were unbelievably delicious. 400 degrees for 40 minutes was perfect.
I changed it up quite a bit, but this gave me an excellent place to start
We made this and really liked it . This seems to be the best way to make them wife and I will be making them again.
I followed this recipe but sprinkled with cinnamon sugar. We loved it. Would be great for Thanksgiving
I added some thyme. awesome with BBQ sauce and parmesan cheese on top!
Loved this dish! It was simple and delicious
Add exactly as written with Wegmans precut. Simple and delish.
Always good I get squash already cut up
Delicious!! Easy!! I wouldn’t make it any other way from now on!! Thank you!

We love this recipe. I make it as one of the siide dishes when we have prime rib. My father really likes it, so when I tell him to buy 2, he buys , giving me a subtle hint to make more! Also, I've made this even more simple a few years ago when I forgot to buy garlic and had to use dried minced garlic. It was the best mistake I made and I've not used fresh garlic since.
I just loved How easy it was to make just cooking in the oven for husband and myself for our chicken Dinner
Delish the whole family loved it!
Easy to make and it was delicious.
L.O.V.E. this yummy and simple recipe. I’ve made this recipe numerous times but haven’t rated it! Well, tonight’s the night as it’s roasting in the oven as I type.
I have never cared for butternut squash but this is delicious! We loved it and it couldn't hardly be any easier to make! I bought the squash already cut up even.

I love this recipe! My honey is a Type II diabetic, so he has to avoid carbs, and he says that the texture of this dish is so close to that of potatoes that it's become one of his faves. Plus, it's got all the paleo goodness of squash (beta carotene and all) and good fats. 
It's incredibly easy to prepare, too. I make it to go with roast chicken, steak, salmon and more.
It didn't taste as good as it could have: it needed more seasoning. Other than that, it was pretty good!
It’s my go to for butternut squash. Super delicious. Better with fresh squash than from frozen.
My family and I did not care for the garlic taste on the squash. I was excited to try it but turns out we prefer just oil, salt and pepper for squash
A friend gave me a small squash. Made this recipe and I ate the whole thing in one sitting. Plus the rest of my dinner that didnt really go with it. I thought there would be plenty of leftovers..lol
Simple & perfect. We typically skip the garlic because my 4 yr old twins don’t care for a lot of garlic.

I hate any and all squash - have not eaten any for at least 40 years... Due to Covid boredom I decided to go out on a limb and try this roasted butternut squash recipe, which I followed to a "t". It was actually good, not great but good enough that I am discarding my squash prejudice. Try it, you'll like it.
Loved it!! Can’t wait to make another one
I had to add to the accolades. Easy, flavorful, perfect!
No changes it was easy to make and tasted really good glad I saved this recipe.
Soooo good! Such a great recipe for a beginning like myself!
Time-consuming, but family loved it
Can I use frozen butternut squash that is thawed to make this? I bought one and chopped it all up and threw it in the freezer so it wouldn’t go to waste!!
wonderful simple dish.

It was a hit at Christmas dinner. I made it like the video and added freshly grated parmigiana cheese and fresh chopped parsley. Even guest who said they don’t usually like butternut squash went back for seconds.

I made this as a vegetable side dish to some pan seared salmon and some orzo and it was the best part of the meal! It is simple but so delicious!
I have always been an acorn squash lover and didn't care to try other winter squashes. I am glad that Instacart shopper who did my groceries few days ago got me a butternut squash as a substitution.
easy
Excellent! Easy to make and delicious. I have made this several times. I had never cooked butternut squash before and so happy to have tried this recipe.
I used cumin, onion powder,chili seasoning , garlic powder, salt, and pepper. After roasting I blended and added chicken broth for a delicious soup

I've made this recipe several times and it always comes out perfect.

Savory. Colorful. Hearty.

At times I add about a tablespoon of some finely chopped French rosemary - if I have it in the fridge.

Either way - with or without Rosemary added - is delectable.

-N. Campbell
The ease of making and it taste really good.

I looked up the recipe for the cooking time. We like both savory and sweet preparations of butternut, and this time we did sweet -- melted 2 TBS bacon fat, tossed the squash in it, crushed 2 tsp coriander seeds and tossed again with pink salt to taste, placed on baking sheet, sprinkled 1/4 c brown sugar on top, and waited. Melt in your mouth with a kind of toffee quality from the sugar, and the coriander really made it stand out for us.
Fast and easy recipe to follow.
I liked it the way he did it it very nice

I thought this was yummy. I probably cut the cubes a little smaller than 1 inch. I sprinkled them with parsley and a little parmigiano-reggiano when done. My teens, who are generally not fans of roasted veggies, didn't hate it.

no muss no fuss. Great mid-week recipe. had it on the table in less than an hour. Since it bakes, I was able to focus on the rest of the meal while it cooked hassle free. Taste winner for the whole family too.

OMG, was this good. I had bought the already cubed squash, so I just guestimated the amounts. I used 1C (generous) cubed squash/serving and there were no leftovers. I did add just a light dusting of Spice Island's Rosemary Garlic. This is a keeper, thank you!

Very easy and simple as directed. My only addition was I added the juice of half a freshly squeezed lemon, drizzled with honey for extra sweetness and topped with sour cream. Agreed easy to see as a meal itself and will do again maybe adding some nutmeg.
Nice change. Might try drizzling maple syrup on next time!
Delicious! I used coconut oil instead and added some Braggs’s Organic Sprinkle seasoning-amazing served over spinach
My new favorite way to eat butternut squash! Even if I don't have garlic on hand, it's good enough to eat an entire squash myself.

Such a fresh side dish! Took suggestions of other reviewer and cooked in microwave for 4 minutes before peeling and chopping.
So helpful! Can't wait to make again!
I just sprinkled some Parmigiano Reggiano on top. Delish:)
Very easy to follow recipe for my first time making anything with squash :)
This was fantastic! Added twist after roasting the butternut squash, my husband popped them into the air fryer to crisp them up they were great! I will be making this dish again!
Instead of using both garlic and salt I just used a little garlic salt...a little goes a long way. It was delicious and I would definitely make again
This recipe is so simple and it taste so yummy And I didn’t change a thing?great job!? and
You MUST use a Y-shaped peeler to peel. It will not work with a traditional peeler. Takes me less that one minute for a large squash.
Best recipe for butternut squash yet. Couldn’t stop grabbing a taste while waiting to plate.
This is perfect......yum
Delicious. I punctured the squash with a fork and microwaved for four minutes to make cutting and peeling easier but used the same recipe.
We were given a butternut squash and aren’t really fans. So tried this recipe and we both really did like it. It will be our go to the next time we are gifted one!
Yummy.... simple and good

Super delicious and super easy. This was a hit with myself, hubby, and son. Someone had given a tip on cutting squash (separate ball from chimney, cut ball in half to scoop seeds, use peeler to peel, making sure to peel down to below green lines under skin) which really helped getting prepped. Definitely will make again and again!

Really simple, delicious and nutritious!

I doubled the recipe. I cut it up before roasting it, as it gives those flavors a chance to meld with the squash. Even though cutting it takes time, it is still easy to do. 

Because I was making turkey tenderloins in the oven, too, these cooked instead for an hour at 325. Toward the end of that hour, I raised the temp to 400 both times finish the turkey and the squash, but the squash got an extra 5 to 10 minutes at that temp.

My whole family liked the squash, except for my youngest. (In the future I will need to hold some squash back to prepare like sweet potatoes for her.)
It came out delicious. This was my first time cooking butternut squash
